result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin P Gonion

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dustin P Gonion in court.  Attorney Carl W Knepel appeared by video for Dustin P Gonion.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint and reserves all other jurisdictional rights and objections. 
Not guilty plea(s).  Jury calendar. 
Offer deadline 12-02-2022 
Scheduling conference 01-11-2023 at 11:10am
Scheduling conference on January 11, 2023 at 11:10 am.
Notice of hearing given to defendant in court.

Defendant in person, having appeared voluntarily on warrant. The matter is continued for initial appearance on 10-20-22 at 10:30 in B-15.  Previously furnished $650 recognizance bond is continued with all of its conditions.
MTPD contacted to cancel warrant.
Minutes.
Initial appearance on October 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Dustin P Gonion not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failed to appear for initial appearance.
Bench warrant authorized.

11:25 AM Defendant Dustin P Gonion in court.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant requests counsel.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 08-26-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of battery and disorderly conduct.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-15-22 at 10:30 a.m. B-15.  Bail is set at $650.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with the Manitowoc County Expo grounds through midnight on 08-28-22 and no contact with U.R.M., DOB: 02-02-2002.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
